sa784:1.2: One time, the Buddha stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park in Jeta’s Grove of Śrāvastī.
sa784:2.1: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks,
sa784:2.3: Listen closely and well consider it.
sa784:2.4: I will explain this for you.
sa784:3.2: This refers to wrong view … wrong concentration.
sa784:3.4: This refers to right view … right concentration.
sa784:4.2: It’s refers to the teaching that there’s generosity, there’s the teaching, there are observances, there’s good conduct and bad conduct, and there are the results of good and bad conduct.
sa784:4.3: There’s this world, and there’s the other world.
sa784:4.4: There’s father and mother and the birth of sentient beings.
sa784:4.5: There are arhats who well arrive, are well-headed, and know and realize for themselves the perfect abode, whether it’s in this or the other world:
sa784:4.6: ‘My births have been ended, the religious practice has been established, the task has been accomplished.
sa784:4.7: I know that I won’t be subject to a later existence.’
sa784:5.2: It’s intent of renunciation, intent without anger, and intent that’s not harmful.
sa784:6.2: It’s being free of false speech, free of duplicity, free of harsh words, and free of fancy speech.
sa784:7.2: It’s being free of killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct.
sa784:8.2: It’s pursuing clothing, food and drink, bedding, and medicine in ways that are according to the teaching and not contrary to the teaching.
sa784:9.2: It’s desire, effort, method, setting out, striving, and the capability to work constantly and not retreat.
sa784:10.2: It’s mindfully following and remembering that’s not false or pointless.
sa784:11.2: It’s abiding with mind unconfused, resolute, collected, tranquil, concentrated, and single-minded.”
sa784:12.1: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and approved.
